a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Literacy rates of adult males, one-sentence test (DHS) vs. self-reports
DHS literacy rates are defined as the percentage of male survey respondents, aged 15 and above, who can read a whole
or part of a sentence showed. UNESCO literacy rates correspond to the percentage of mean, aged 15 and above, who say
they can read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

Literacy rate - UNESCO
(% of males ages 15 and above)

Literacy rate - DHS surveys
(% of males ages 15 and above)
Data source: DHS Surveys; UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS), via World Bank (2025)
